The first Collection Amount may include additional fees or charges. 
(If applicable,) - SBIB/ VUM/ Santam may change the Collection Amount based on changes to the policy annual increases in the benefits AND where you request changes to your policy.
SBIB/ VUM/ Santam will debit the Collection Amount on xxxx_ day and thereafter on the _____xxx day of every month, or on any other day that you have funds in your Bank Account (Collection Date). 
The Collection Amount will carry an Abbreviated Short Name which is your policy number, which will be provided to you before the first Collection Date. This policy number will help you to identify the Collection Amount on your bank statement.
If the Collection Date falls on a non-processing day (Sunday or public holiday), you agree that the Collection Amount may be debited against the Bank Account on the first business day thereafter.
(Only SILC) If there are not enough funds in the Bank Account on the Collection Date, SBIB will track the Bank Account (at no cost to you) and debit the Collection Amount on another day during the month when there is money in your Bank Account. 
Where the debit of the Collection Amount is successful on more than two consecutive occasions on a date other than your selected date, your Collection Date will automatically default to the successful date.  
If the Collection Amount does not go through for any reason, you understand that your insurance cover may be impacted.
The total amount that is collected under this Debit Order Mandate will never be more than the amounts of your policy premium.
The authority to debit your bank account remains in force until the insurance policy is terminated for any reason or you give us one month’s written notice that you wish to cancel such authority. You understand that if you cancel the authority to debit your bank account, your insurance policy will be cancelled, and all benefits will cease. (VUM Fintech Only) Please note that the Premium Due Date of this Policy is ALWAYS the 1st of the month no matter the method of payment, and you therefore have 15 day’s grace after this date to pay your premium. If you do not make payment of the premium by the Due Date, you are entitled to a grace period of 15 (fifteen) days after the Due Date (except in the first month) in which to pay the premium. If a claim occurred after the 1st and payment was not made on or before the 16th, the claim will NOT be considered. (VUM Taxi Only)
It is your full responsibility to ensure premiums are paid as per the above conditions. Non-payment of the premium in the month of inception (in the first month), for whatever reason, will result in the Policy being voided. If the premium is not received by the end of the grace period, you will not enjoy cover from the 1st of the month. If the premiums are not paid for two consecutive months, this Policy will be cancelled (Santam only) 
(Senate Only)

Automatic Benefit Increase which means that you have the option to have your cover amount automatically increase annually to keep up with increasing burial expenses. The Cashback benefit starts from the time it is added to the policy and pays 10% of the total policy premiums that was received back to the customer within a 5-
year cycle Grocery benefit of up to R24 000. This benefit provides a set amount paid monthly for the purpose of the cost of groceries for the family when the Policyholder or Spouse dies. Airtime Benefit of up to R1000, The Airtime benefit is meant to assist the family with cell phone airtime in order to contact relatives and make arrangements for the funeral. Repatriation of up to R25 000, This benefit is paid in addition to the Funeral benefit because we know how costly transport costs can be. Your policy will carry the following restrictions and waiting periods in terms of the cover you have selected today:
The waiting period from the policy start is 6 months (with 6 premiums needing to be paid) for natural causes of death before a claim will be paid. Accidental death is covered immediately upon collection of the first premium. The policy does not cover any claims for suicide for the first 12 months (and 12 premiums also must have been paid).To qualify for the Premium Waiver benefit to be paid, the policy must have been active for 6 months, with at least 6 premiums being paid.

Optional Automatic Benefit Increase which means that you have the option to have your cover amount automatically increased annually to keep up with increasing inflation,in order to keep up with annual inflation and to ensure that your beneficiaries are taken care of when you can’t provide for them is that you can choose whether or not you would like your benefits to increase annually. You have the option to select this increase to be set at 5% or 10% depending on your preference – or you can choose not to have your benefits increase at all – and this will mean that your cover will remain at RXXXXX (Sum insured chosen by the customer). An additional annual premium increase will apply if you select this option and you can stop this benefit if you wish. Optional Cashback benefit – you have the option to choose a cashback option –which means that should you choose this benefit; you will receive a percentage of your premiums paid back to you every 5 years (an additional premium applies if you add this benefit).  The Flexible Life Plan product also has the option of a CashBack benefit – which allows you choose whether you would like to receive a percentage (currently 10%) of your premiums collected, every 5 years – provided your policy premiums are up to date. Can I include a Cashback option for you, <Client name>?

Accidental Death benefit which is paid out after a policy is activated despite the waiting period, which means that should you pass away because of an accident – your beneficiary will receive your life cover payout as well as an additional amount which is equal to your benefit amount but limited to a maximum of R100 000. And another great benefit that this policy gives you is that there is also an Immediate Expenses benefit which is paid within 48 hours of receipt of the claim documents and the claim being valid. This means that a portion of your Life Cover benefits will be paid to you within 48 hours and will be limited to a maximum of R100 000. Premium Waiver will pay 6 premiums of the policy if the principal life assured passes away and if there is a spouse also covered (the policy must be active for 6 months).  Premium Waiver benefit on this product - should you pass away, the remaining spouse on the policy will remain covered for a further 6 months and no premiums will be payable. Within this 6-month period, your spouse may make the decision to either continue the policy (by becoming the new policyholder and premium payer) or end the policy.

Hollard - Power Surge (Contents/Building):
We will cover you for loss or damage to the household goods caused by power surge up to a maximum limit of R25 000 in each 12-month period of insurance. Power surges happen when the flow of electricity is interrupted, then started again, or when something sends electricity flowing back into the system. Please refer to the policy wording for terms & conditions. If you choose to install a surge arrester then no excess will apply, but please 
note that it must be South African National Service (SANS) approved, installed on the home's main electrical distribution board and the device must: 
1.1 Be wired in terms of SANS 
1.2 Have mechanical tabs to indicate if the arrester is operational or not. 
1.3 Be installed by a registered electrician who must provide a Certificate of Compliance for the installation.

"Hollard - Power Surge (Contents/Building):
We will cover you for loss or damage to the household goods caused by power surge up to a maximum limit of R25 000 in each 12-month period of insurance. Power surges happen when the flow of electricity is interrupted, then started again, or when something sends electricity flowing back into the system. Please refer to the policy wording for terms & conditions. If you choose to install a surge arrester then no excess will apply, but please 
note that it must be South African National Service (SANS) approved, installed on the home's main electrical distribution board and the device must: 
1.1 Be wired in terms of SANS 
1.2 Have mechanical tabs to indicate if the arrester is operational or not. 
1.3 Be installed by a registered electrician who must provide a Certificate of Compliance for the installation."

One of our most popular benefits is the minimum cover benefit, that is designed to ensure you get from your cover the value that you're giving. This benefit pays an amount of up to R20,000. For example, if you had an outstanding balance of R10,000 (which is below the minimum cover of R20,000) and you were to suffer from a dread disease, Standard Bank Insurance Brokers would settle the outstanding balance of R10,000 into your loan account, and then pay the remaining R10,000 into your loan - so you can be sure that you will receive the minimum cover of R20,000 in total. In the event that the balance on the loan is positive (credit balance) or zero, Standard Bank would actually pay the full R20,000 into your loan account. You qualify for the minimum cover benefit if your outstanding balance at the time of the covered incident is below R20,000 - otherwise you will be covered as per what I explained earlier.

Hollard - Tracking Requirement:
We will not pay a claim for theft or hijacking in any of the following instances: 
• One device requirement: The device is not either a radio frequency or an early-warning tracking device which includes vehicle recovery. 
• Two devices requirement: Neither tracking devices are an early-warning tracking device which includes vehicle recovery (unless we have agreed to a device that is not early warning). 
• The tracking devices were not in working order at the time of the incident. 
• Your contract was not active at the time of the incident. 
• You did not comply with the conditions of that contract. 
• You did not report the theft or hijacking to the tracking company immediately after the incident

Hollard - Power Surge (Contents/Building):
We will cover you for loss or damage to the household goods caused by power surge up to a maximum limit of R25 000 in each 12-month period of insurance. Power surges happen when the flow of electricity is interrupted, then started again, or when something sends electricity flowing back into the system. Please refer to the policy wording for terms & conditions. If you choose to install a surge arrester then no excess will apply, but please 
note that it must be South African National Service (SANS) approved, installed on the home's main electrical distribution board and the device must: 
1.1 Be wired in terms of SANS 
1.2 Have mechanical tabs to indicate if the arrester is operational or not. 
1.3 Be installed by a registered electrician who must provide a Certificate of Compliance for the installation.

Optional Automatic Benefit Increase which means that you have the option to have your cover amount automatically increased annually to keep up with increasing inflation, in order to keep up with annual inflation and to ensure that your beneficiaries are taken care of when you can’t provide for them is that you can choose whether or not you would like your benefits to increase annually. You have the option to select this increase to be set at 5% or 10% depending on your preference – or you can choose not to have your benefits increase at all – and this will mean that your cover will remain at RXXXXX (Sum insured chosen by the customer). An additional annual premium increase will apply if you select this option, and you can stop this benefit if you wish.

Optional Cashback benefit – you have the option to choose a cashback option –which means that should you choose this benefit; you will receive a percentage of your premiums paid back to you every 5 years (an additional premium applies if you add this benefit).  The Flexible Life Plan product also has the option of a Cashback benefit – which allows you choose whether you would like to receive a percentage (currently 10%) of your premiums collected, every 5 years – provided your policy premiums are up to date. Accidental Death benefit which is paid out after a policy is activated despite the waiting period, which means that should you pass away because of an accident – your beneficiary will receive your life cover payout as well as an additional amount which is equal to your benefit amount but limited to a maximum of R100 000.

And another great benefit that this policy gives you is that there is also an Immediate Expenses benefit which is paid within 48 hours of receipt of the claim documents and the claim being valid. This means that a portion of your Life Cover benefits will be paid to you within 48 hours and will be limited to a maximum of R100 000.

Premium Waiver will pay 6 premiums of the policy if the principal life assured passes away and if there is a spouse also covered (the policy must be active for 6 months).  Premium Waiver benefit on this product - should you pass away, the remaining spouse on the policy will remain covered for a further 6 months and no premiums will be payable. Within this 6-month period, your spouse may make the decision to either continue the policy (by becoming the new policyholder and premium payer) or end the policy.
